The goal is to compute the derivative

children.value: Numerical differentiation is a crucial tool in various fields such as physics, engineering, and finance. It allows us to estimate the rate of change of a function based on discrete data points, which is essential for understanding trends, optimizing processes, and making predictions.
Numerical differentiation

# setup
%matplotlib ipympl
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib as mpl

jupyter_data.name: stderr
jupyter_data.text: Matplotlib is building the font cache; this may take a moment.

children.value: Create synthetic data
For this notebook we use data coming from a known function. In this way, we can check the accuracy of the results.
the underlying function :
Plotting the function and its derivative:

N = 400
xmin, xmax = 0.0, 4
x = np.linspace(xmin, xmax, N)

fig = plt.figure()
plt.plot(x, f(x), "b", label="$f(x)$")
plt.legend()
plt.grid()

fig = plt.figure()
plt.plot(x, df(x), "b", label="$\dfrac{df}{dx}$")
plt.legend()
plt.grid()

children.value: Now we assume that only 40 points of this function are known:

children.label: Now we assume that only 40 points of this function are known:

children.value:
N = 40
xmin, xmax = 0.0, 4
xi = np.linspace(xmin, xmax, N)
fi = f(xi)

fig = plt.figure()
plt.plot(xi, fi, "o", label="the discretize data $(x_i,f_i)$")
plt.legend()
plt.grid()

text/html.content: Figure

children.value: The one point finite difference formula

children.label: The one point finite difference formula

children.value: \dfrac{df}{dx} = \dfrac{f(x_{i+1})-f(x_i)}{x_{i+1}-x_i}
children.html: dfdx=f(xi+1)−f(xi)xi+1−xi\dfrac{df}{dx} = \dfrac{f(x_{i+1})-f(x_i)}{x_{i+1}-x_i}dxdf​=xi+1​−xi​f(xi+1​)−f(xi​)​

children.value: The numpy diff() function is a fast way to compute this formula:
df_1p = np.diff(fi) / np.diff(xi)
But becarefull the size of the resulting array is equal to

children.html: n−1n-1n−1

children.value:
fig = plt.figure()
plt.plot(x, df(x), "b", label="Analytical derivative")
plt.plot(xi[:-1], df_1p, "ro", label="Finite difference derivative (1 point)")
plt.legend()
plt.grid()
plt.show()
The 2 points finite difference formula

children.html: dfdx=f(xi+1)−f(xi−1)xi+1−xi−1\dfrac{df}{dx} = \dfrac{f(x_{i+1})-f(x_{i-1})}{x_{i+1}-x_{i-1}}dxdf​=xi+1​−xi−1​f(xi+1​)−f(xi−1​)​

children.value: Slicing method of numpy array is a good way to do such operation

# Slicing exemple
a = np.linspace(0, 6, 7)
print(a[2:])
print(a[:-2])
With slicing methode of numpy array the 2 points formula can be fast computed:

fig = plt.figure()
plt.plot(x, df(x), "b", label="Analytical derivative")
plt.plot(xi[:-1], df_1p, "ro", label="Finite difference derivative (1 point)")
plt.plot(xi[1:-1], df_2p, "gs", label="Finite difference derivative (2 points)")
plt.legend()
plt.grid()
Let’s have a look at the error on the derivative computation

children.label: Let’s have a look at the error on the derivative computation

children.value:
fig = plt.figure()
plt.plot(
    xi[:-1], (df_1p - df(xi[:-1])), "ro", label="Finite difference derivative (1 point)"
)
plt.plot(
    xi[1:-1],
    (df_2p - df(xi[1:-1])),
    "gs",
    label="Finite difference derivative (2 points)",
)
plt.legend()
plt.grid()
What append if the data are noisy ?

children.label: What append if the data are noisy ?

children.value: fi_noise = f(xi) + 0.5 * np.random.randn(fi.size)

fig = plt.figure()
plt.plot(x, f(x), ":r", label="$f(x)$")
plt.plot(xi, fi_noise, "o", label="noisy data")
plt.legend()
plt.grid()
The 2 points fomrula is the more accurate. Let’s use it to derivate the noisy data:

children.label: The 2 points fomrula is the more accurate. Let’s use it to derivate the noisy data:

children.value: df_2p_n = (fi_noise[2:] - fi_noise[:-2]) / (xi[2:] - xi[:-2])

fig = plt.figure()
plt.plot(x, df(x), ":r", label="Analytical derivative")
plt.plot(xi[1:-1], df_2p_n, "-g", label="Finite difference derivative of noisy data")
plt.legend()
plt.grid()
The obtaine results is not valuable for further use. Other methodes should be used to evaluat derivative of noisy data.

children.label: The obtaine results is not valuable for further use. Other methodes should be used to evaluat derivative of noisy data.
